intro: Ficinia tribracteata, commonly known as the three-bract fig, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Moraceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as the common fig and breadfruit. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and unique inflorescence structure that includes three bracts. Its fruit is typically small and edible, though it is not as widely consumed as other fig species. The plant plays a role in local ecosystems and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
